Surfacemaps¶

plysurfacehandler.surfacemap_utils.create_gridmap_from(up, left, down, right, vertexpositions: Iterable[Tuple[float, float, float]], edges, vertexlist=None)¶
Todo

instead of linspace use all used u and v positions as crossproduct

class plysurfacehandler.surfacemap_utils.surfacemap(s_array: Iterable[float], t_array: Iterable[float], datamatrix: Tuple[Tuple[Tuple[float, ...], ...], ...], bounds_error=False)¶

Bases: object

Class to map a 2d-quadrat(1.0x1.0) to a multidimensional surface. 2d-space is defined by 2 arrays. The available points in the 2d-space is the product of those arrays. The multidimensional surface is defined by a datamatrix (2+x)D.

Variables

  • datamatrix – Datamatrix with an x-dimensional array per vertice

  • s_array – Array corresponding to the first dimension (s[0] c ma[0][x])

  • t_array – Array corresponding to the second dimension (s[0] c ma[x][0])

property uplength: float¶

Length of the upperborder of the surface. Corresponds to s-array at t=max.

property leftlength: float¶

Length of the leftborder of the surface. Corresponds to t-array at s=0

property downlength: float¶

Length of the lower border of the surface. Corresponds to s-array at t=0

property rightlength: float¶

Length of the rightborder of the surface. Corresponds to t-array at s=max

get_point_matrix()¶

Returns all points of the space in matrixform. If 2D-arrays are equidistant only return 3d_space in matrixform. Else returns a matrix with the first 2 entry of the s- and t-array-data

Return type

Tuple[ Tuple[ float,… ]]

get_value_to_st(x: float, y: float) → Tuple[float, ...]¶

Transforms a 2D-point to the corresponding value on the surface

get_derivate_to_st(x: float, y: float) → Tuple[Tuple[float, ...], Tuple[float, ...]]¶

Transforms a 2Dpoint to the corresponding derivate on the surface

Returns

return len(tuple)==2 is derivate in the two direction dx,dy at position x, y

get_transmatrix_dxyz_to_dst(x: float, y: float)¶
classmethod from_datamatrix(datamatrix: Tuple[Tuple[Tuple[float, ...], ...], ...])¶

Creates this Object with a Datamatrix with the pointposition s and t-array will be equidistant

classmethod from_arrays(shape: Tuple[int, int], *arrays: Iterable[float])¶

Creates this Object from data in stream-form(N * 1D-arrays). The shape of the resulting datamatrix must be given extra.

classmethod from_arrays_with_nonregular_xyarrays(x_array: Iterable[float], y_array: Iterable[float], *arrays: Iterable[float])¶

Creates this Object from data in stream-form(N * 1D-arrays). The s and t-array of the map must be given.
